paper_abstract: We are interested in the number of fixed points in AND-OR-NOT networks, i.e. Boolean networks in which the update function of each component is either a conjunction or a disjunction of positive or negative literals. As the main result, we prove that the maximum number of fixed points in a loop-less connected AND-OR-NOT network with n components is at most the maximum number of maximal independent sets in a loop-less connected graph with n vertices, a quantity already known. (C) 2014 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Maximum number of fixed points in AND-OR-NOT networks
